stories.title: Google will face a lawsuit over accusations of collecting kids’ data

stories.text:
I’m trying to move away from Google services this year, but I still have to find a good alternative to Google Docs.

What I’m looking for is an online writing application, that supports sharing in-progress work and allowing reviewers to comment inline. What do you use, if you’re not using Google Docs?
stories.title: Ask HN: What are good alternatives to Google Docs for collaborative writing?
Google Says AI Generated Content Is Against Guidelines

stories.text:
Hi HN!

I'm curious what unexpected team rituals have been helpful for your software development teams as you've been working remotely.

Rituals that are expected:

- everyone on the team writing up weekly summaries.

- record every video conference

- have lots of 1:1 meetings to maintain relationships

Rituals that have been unexpected:

- Posting once a week about what I did for fun over the weekend, usually with photos.

- Setting up longer phone call 1:1s where both attendees are walking.

I think the future of our working relationships will be increasingly remote, but I'm struggling to see interesting creativity for tightly integrated dev teams.

If new ways of working aren't established, I struggle to see how remote teams will compete with teams that meet in person on a weekly/daily basis.
stories.title: Ask HN: Hybrid/Remote software team rituals

stories.text:
I feel as though cloud provider "outages" are often sensationalized, and that most production (customer) infrastructure mostly remains unharmed.

In my experience, I've never actually had service degradation due to cloud provider issues.

Curious to other users hear stories
stories.title: Ask HN: Have Cloud Provider outages caused your business tangible harm?
